Uang Belum Dibalikin, Eks Menko Wiranto Gugat Bambang Rp 44,9 Miliar
05 Nov 2019, 15:22 by Andi Saputra
Jakarta - Mantan Menteri Koordinator Politik, Hukum, dan Keamanan (Menko Polhukam), Wiranto, menggugat Bambang Sujagad Susanto. Wiranto menuntut agar Bambang mengembalikan uang yang dipinjam sebesar SGD 2.310.000 atau setara dengan Rp 23 miliar. Ditambah dengan bunga dan kerugian selama 10 tahun, total tuntutan mencapai Rp 44,9 miliar.
Jenderal TNI (Purn) Wiranto ini menilai Bambang telah melakukan wanprestasi/ingkar janji/cedera janji karena tidak melaksanakan dan mentaati isi surat perjanjian tertanggal 24 November 2009 tentang penitipan dana sebesar SGD 2.310.000. Wiranto yang memberikan kuasa kepada Adi Warman meminta PN Jakpus menyatakan sah dan mengikat surat perjanjian tersebut bagi kedua belah pihak.
"Memerintahkan Tergugat (Bambang Sujagad Susanto) untuk mengembalikan dana sebesar SGD 2.310.000 yang jika dirupiahkan setara dengan Rp 23.663.640.000 kepada Penggugat (Wiranto)," demikian bunyi gugatan Wiranto yang dikutip dari Sistem Informasi Penelusuran Perkara Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Pusat (SIPP PN Jakpus), Selasa (5/11/2019).
Selain mengembalikan uang yang dipinjam sebesar Rp 23 miliar, Bambang dituntut Wiranto membayar ganti rugi sebesar Rp 2,8 miliar. Tidak hanya itu, Bambang juga digugat membayar bunga total Rp 18,5 miliar.
"Menghukum tergugat (Bambang) untuk membayar bunga yang dihitung sejak 24 November 2009 hingga tanggal gugatan a quo diajukan, yaitu sebesar Rp 18.509.699.208," papar Wiranto.
Wiranto juga meminta PN Jakpus menyatakan sah dan berharga sita jaminan yang telah diletakkan dalam perkara ini. Selain itu, menghukum tergugat untuk membayar uang paksa (dwangsom) sebesar Rp 5 juta per hari apabila tidak memenuhi isi putusan ini.
"Menyatakan putusan dalam perkara ini dapat dijalankan lebih dahulu walaupun ada perlawanan (verzet), banding atau kasasi," pungkas Wiranto.

Money Has Not Been Reversed, Former Coordinating Minister Wiranto Sues Bambang Rp. 44.9 Billion
05 Nov 2019, 15:22 by Andi Saputra
Jakarta - Former Coordinating Minister for Politics, Law and Security (Menko Polhukam), Wiranto, sued Bambang Sujagad Susanto. Wiranto demanded that Bambang return the borrowed money of SGD 2,310,000 or equivalent to Rp 23 billion. Coupled with interest and losses for 10 years, the total demand reached Rp 44.9 billion.
This TNI General (Ret.) Wiranto considered Bambang to have broken a promise / broken promise / broken promise for not carrying out and complying with the contents of the agreement dated 24 November 2009 concerning the deposit of funds amounting to SGD 2,310,000. Wiranto, who gave power to Adi Warman, asked the Central Jakarta District Court to declare that it was legal and to bind the agreement to both parties.
"Ordered the Defendant (Bambang Sujagad Susanto) to return funds amounting to SGD 2,310,000 which if equivalent was equivalent to Rp. 23,663,640,000 to the Plaintiff (Wiranto)," the Wiranto lawsuit was quoted as saying from the Central Jakarta District Court's Information SIPP (SIPP PN) Central Jakarta), Tuesday (5/11/2019).
In addition to returning the borrowed money of Rp 23 billion, Bambang was demanded by Wiranto to pay compensation of Rp 2.8 billion. Not only that, Bambang was also sued for paying a total interest of Rp 18.5 billion.
"Punishing the defendant (Bambang) to pay interest calculated from November 24, 2009 until the date the a quo lawsuit was filed, amounting to Rp 18,509,699,208," said Wiranto.
Wiranto also asked the Central Jakarta District Court to declare a valid and valuable seizure of guarantees that had been placed in this case. In addition, punishing the defendant for paying forced money (dwangsom) of Rp. 5 million per day if it did not fulfill the contents of this decision.
"Stating the decision in this case can be carried out first despite resistance (verzet), appeal or appeal," concluded Wiranto.
